snippet: Gov. Chris Christie’s decision to schedule a special election for Senator Frank R. Lautenberg’s seat on Oct. 16 suggests that he evaluated the potential Republican challengers and did not like what he saw.
abstract: Gov. Chris Christie’s decision to schedule a special election for Senator Frank R. Lautenberg’s seat on Oct. 16 suggests that he evaluated the potential Republican challengers and did not like what he saw.

headline.main: Special Election Timing in New Jersey Points to a Weak G.O.P. Field
headline.print_headline: Interim Appointees To Senate Often Fall At Election Time
